description.narrative: This project aims to establish a sustainable protected area financing system, with associated management structures, systems and capacities needed to ensure the effective use of generated revenues for priority biodiversity conservation needs.

participating-org.narrative: Egypt - Ministry of State for Environmental Affairs

description.narrative: seat of a first-order administrative division

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

description.narrative: Objective Establishment of a sustainable protected area financing system with associated management structures systems and capacities needed to ensure the effective use of generated revenues for priority biodiversity conservation needs
Level and diversity of financing for the PA system

comment.narrative:
Financing of protected areas is below 20 of basic scenario
Only two predominant sources government and tourism in use

At project end achieved levels of revenue are within 10 of projection and the trend in growth rates sets the NCS on track to meet the optimal scenario by year 101
At least two new reliable sources of funds are established

According to the official reports on financing of PA system during reporting year a general indicator shows remarkable progress where 25m was allocated as a governmental budget and 17m was allocated to PAs as cosharing for the project toward optimal scenario of PA management
In cooperation with Support protected Areas project under Italian cooperation 05m was allocated for upgrading the PAs infrastructure equipments and staff capacities
Financial reports of NCS show that PA revenues generated during 2015 is approx 9 million including PAs entrance fees and concessions and
Two new management systems were prepared Northern Red Sea Islands and Wadi Degla Protected Areas the eight priority PAs now all use a consistent format
The management system plans for the eight priority PAs were revised including the overall management strategy work plans and budgets to align with NCSs new Strategic Plan 2014
Four management system plans have been submitted to NCS for revision and four are remaining They will all be revised until approved by EEAA Once approved the project can ensure allocation of the set budget from both EEAA and the project budget
A Concession Committee has been founded to prepare the RFPs for any concession projects touristic activitiesvistor center within three PAs Wadi Rayan Wadi Degla and Wadi El Gemal and this will generate revenues of 22 million over 10 years and will be reevaluated after 10 years which will be proposed for bidding

At project end achieved levels of revenue are within 10 of projection and the trend in growth rates sets the NCS on track to meet the optimal scenario by year 101
At least two new reliable sources of funds are established

According to the official reports on financing of PA system during reporting year a general indicator shows remarkable progress where 25m was allocated as a governmental budget and 17m was allocated to PAs as cosharing for the project toward optimal scenario of PA management
In cooperation with Support protected Areas project under Italian cooperation 05m was allocated for upgrading the PAs infrastructure equipments and staff capacities
Financial reports of NCS show that PA revenues generated during 2015 is approx 9 million including PAs entrance fees and concessions and
Two new management systems were prepared Northern Red Sea Islands and Wadi Degla Protected Areas the eight priority PAs now all use a consistent format
The management system plans for the eight priority PAs were revised including the overall management strategy work plans and budgets to align with NCSs new Strategic Plan 2014
Four management system plans have been submitted to NCS for revision and four are remaining They will all be revised until approved by EEAA Once approved the project can ensure allocation of the set budget from both EEAA and the project budget
A Concession Committee has been founded to prepare the RFPs for any concession projects touristic activitiesvistor center within three PAs Wadi Rayan Wadi Degla and Wadi El Gemal and this will generate revenues of 22 million over 10 years and will be reevaluated after 10 years which will be proposed for bidding

Flagship species at several priority PAs have been declining including species to be defined
Ras Mohamed PA corals Acropora Pocillipora and Millipora Reptiles Green turtle Logger head Mammals Dugong dugong and Dorcas gazelle
Flagship species in PAs of terrestrial biomes recover or maintained including

The integrated monitoring program training took place whereEight action plans were developed to monitor 5 groups of target species including reptiles Nile crocodile plants Typhadomingensis Capparisspinosa Avicennia marina birds mammals Cape hare Swamp cat Egyptian mongoose Dorcas gazelle Nubian ibex Barbary sheep coral reef including bioindicator fishes and coral Marine turtles mangroves sea grass sea cucumber algae dolphins shark dugong
Monitoring manuals were also prepared for each group of species these manuals will be used as guidelines for any researcher to monitor any of these species
Flagship species in PAs of terrestrial biomes recover or maintained including

The integrated monitoring program training took place whereEight action plans were developed to monitor 5 groups of target species including reptiles Nile crocodile plants Typhadomingensis Capparisspinosa Avicennia marina birds mammals Cape hare Swamp cat Egyptian mongoose Dorcas gazelle Nubian ibex Barbary sheep coral reef including bioindicator fishes and coral Marine turtles mangroves sea grass sea cucumber algae dolphins shark dugong
Monitoring manuals were also prepared for each group of species these manuals will be used as guidelines for any researcher to monitor any of these species

description.narrative: Levels of live coral coverage in dive sites and nondive sites

comment.narrative: Most Red Sea dive sites are being degraded by heavy and careless diving

No significant degradation measured in new dive sites to be opened to special seasonal tourists
Degradation in old dive sites does not increase

A monitoring workshop was prepared during which target species for each ecosystem were selected and an action plan was prepared to monitor them Two meetings were held to discuss these documents and introduce the prepared monitoring manuals for the selected target species The monitoring of most target species took place without followup this year monitoring of all target species will take place with aid from EPASP SEPA and NCS and the results of coral reef monitoring will be gathered

No significant degradation measured in new dive sites to be opened to special seasonal tourists
Degradation in old dive sites does not increase

A monitoring workshop was prepared during which target species for each ecosystem were selected and an action plan was prepared to monitor them Two meetings were held to discuss these documents and introduce the prepared monitoring manuals for the selected target species The monitoring of most target species took place without followup this year monitoring of all target species will take place with aid from EPASP SEPA and NCS and the results of coral reef monitoring will be gathered

description.narrative: Outcome 1 Policy regulatory and institutional frameworks that facilitate revenue generation revenue retention and other aspects of sustainable PA financing and management are established and operational

NCSs Strategic Plan of 20142019 was implemented and all PA documents were changed accordingly eg Management Systems
The establishment of NCA has been accepted A minister memo was submitted in hopes of receiving an official letter stating that the NCA will indeed take place so that the projects activities are in line with the governmental institution
Explicit policies and procedures to negotiate monitor and implement institutional arrangements with business and social actors

NCSs Strategic Plan of 20142019 was implemented and all PA documents were changed accordingly eg Management Systems
The establishment of NCA has been accepted A minister memo was submitted in hopes of receiving an official letter stating that the NCA will indeed take place so that the projects activities are in line with the governmental institution
Generated revenues are comingled with revenues from other sources and allocations to NCS are adhoc and minimal
Internal registry system accounting system for NCS established within EPF accounting for revenues generated and disbursements by end of project inception period
Financial arrangements for revenue reinjection were done through Ministerial approval on allocation for PAs based on the management systems of targeted PAs which have been conducted by the project

Financial sustainability unit established at Headquarters level

PAs Financial Affairs
Economic Valuation of Ecosystem Services
Organizational Behavior Recruitment Selection
A guide was also prepared on PAs Financial Affairs for PA financial and managerial staff

No policies to guide level of reinjection
Revenue reinjection A Ministerial Decree establishing a 10year policy of achieving an optimal financing scenario largely through reinjected revenues

The financial plans of the target PAs were reviewed based on NCSs new strategic plan and integrated into their respective Management Plans The budgets were approved by the Minister of Environment and also split between two types of funds NCS funds and the projects funds from Ministry of planning
Revenue reinjection A Ministerial Decree establishing a 10year policy of achieving an optimal financing scenario largely through reinjected revenues

The financial plans of the target PAs were reviewed based on NCSs new strategic plan and integrated into their respective Management Plans The budgets were approved by the Minister of Environment and also split between two types of funds NCS funds and the projects funds from Ministry of planning
No strategy

Comprehensive 5year financing strategy including a financial needs assessment defining targets standards procedures and criteria for resource allocation is approved at ministerial level by end of year 2
According to PAs financing strategy 10 million LE 15 m were allocated to support the implementation of 5 PAs management systems which has been approved by the minister of Environment

description.narrative: Outcome 3 Business planning and costeffective management systems are ensuring the effective allocation and management of mobilized resources

comment.narrative: Adhoc arrangements
Community partnership system tested in at least one PA

The project helped local communities participate in four bazaars and forums in Cairo by selling natural and organic products using the natural carton casing and wrapping developed during last years workshop Local communities from Wadi El Rayan Wadi El Gemal Saint Katherine and Siwa participated The project was able to convince local communities in Siwa to send women to stand in the booths and sell their own products most of the products sold especially those from WGPA Saint Katherine and Siwa are produced by women
Community partnership system tested in at least one PA

The project helped local communities participate in four bazaars and forums in Cairo by selling natural and organic products using the natural carton casing and wrapping developed during last years workshop Local communities from Wadi El Rayan Wadi El Gemal Saint Katherine and Siwa participated The project was able to convince local communities in Siwa to send women to stand in the booths and sell their own products most of the products sold especially those from WGPA Saint Katherine and Siwa are produced by women
Baseline scores
Improved management effectiveness in eight PAs altogether covering 185 million ha as follows

METT has been developed in two new PAs Wadi Degla and Red Sea Northern Islands along with its respective Management System as well as in two untargeted PAs Siwa with a baseline score of 56 and Omayed with a baseline score of 43
Improved management effectiveness in eight PAs altogether covering 185 million ha as follows

METT has been developed in two new PAs Wadi Degla and Red Sea Northern Islands along with its respective Management System as well as in two untargeted PAs Siwa with a baseline score of 56 and Omayed with a baseline score of 43

Business plans in 23 sites but not operational
Management plans in several sites but lacking funds for implementation

By end of project eight priority PAs are operated according to a full and consistent set of business and management planning tools
Standardized high quality

3 commercial services plans are in place where two new plans is being developed in Wadi Degla and Wadi El Rayan PAs The TOR was prepared and uploaded to UNDPs international website
Two new management systems were developed in 2015 Wadi Degla and Red Sea Northern Islands with approximately all PAs staff present The remaining six management plans were reviewed with PA managers to match the new NCS strategic plan All the management systems were changed to a standard format and the financial plans were reviewed by an NCS financial planner In addition four other financial plans were reviewed by a UNDP financial intern NCS has reviewed four management plans and made minor edits those and the remaining four are estimated to be approved by NCS this year
One new Economic valuation study is being developed for Wadi El Rayan and another is being redeveloped for Ras Mohamed PA
The project also participated in the Economic Forum in March of 2015 where the possible investments within PAs were presented as well as organizing a workshop for tour guides and tour operators in Egypt

description.narrative: At project end, achieved levels of revenue are within 10% of projection and the trend in growth rates sets the NCS on track to meet the optimal scenario.

comment.narrative: Financing of protected areas is below 20% of basic scenario.

At project end, achieved levels of revenue are within 10% of projection and the trend in growth rates sets the NCS on track to meet the optimal scenario by year 10. At least two new, reliable sources of funds are established. No significant degradation measured in new dive sites to be opened to special seasonal tourists. Degradation in old dive sites does not increase. Flagship species in PAs of terrestrial biomes recover or maintained, Comprehensive 5-year financing strategy, including a financial needs assessment defining targets, standards, procedures and criteria for resource allocation, is approved at ministerial level by end of year 2. Explicit policies and procedures to negotiate, monitor and implement institutional arrangements with business and social actors.Internal registry system (accounting system) for NCS established within EPF, accounting for revenues generated and disbursements, by end of project inception period. Revenue re-injection: A Ministerial Decree establishing a 10-year policy of achieving an optimal financing scenario largely through re-injected revenues.Financial sustainability unit established at Headquarters level.Revenues generated by PA system over 6-year project duration total approximately $74 milllion with final exact figures depending on final financial needs assessments and basic and optimal scenarios.Revenues re-injected into PA system over 6-year project duration total approximately $53 million, with final exact figures depending on final financial needs assessments and basic and optimal scenarios

Conducting the Willingness-to- Pay Survey to improve the fee collection system at five protected areas (Wadi Degla,Wadi El Rayan, Ras Mohamed , Wadi El Gemal and Blue Hole PAs ). The introduction of entrance fees at Wadi El Gemal NP The Development of Wadi Degla & Petrified Forest Sustainable Financing and Management Model .The Development of Blue Hole Diving site Sustainable Financing and Management plan. Review and update Wadi Degla Camping fees. Review and update PAs concession pricing system.The development of Conservation and sustainable management plan for Sharm El Sheikh marine environment and Ras Mohamed NP.The development of The Natural resources damage assessment study’. Conducting Baseline survey and sensitivity map and preparing site level management plan for Blue Hole Diving site .Supporting the procurement process to supply patrolling boats for Ras Mohamed NP, Wadi El Gemal NP and Northern Islands Marine Parks. The development of Conservation and sustainable management plan for Sharm El Sheikh marine environment and Ras Mohamed NP.The development of The Natural resources damage assessment study’ Conducting Baseline survey and sensitivity map and preparing site level management plan for Blue Hole Diving site Supporting the procurement process to supply patrolling boats for Ras Mohamed NP, Wadi El Gemal NP and Northern Islands Marine Parks.Developing the Zoning Plan for Ras Mohamed National Park and Wadi Degla. Conducting monitoring for natural resources focusing on four Flagship species at Wadi El Gemal NP.Development of Threatened Plants Management Plan in Saint Katherine PA. Conducting Technical Training on (Dealing with Sharks within Marine PA).• A long-term system-level financing strategy has been developed, approved and is currently under implementation • The development of "Institutional Reform Proposal" to upgrade NCS to an independent agency that has the suitable managerial structures to enable the national PAs systems to be more financially sustainable. • The new PAs Agency Proposal sent to Parliament, discussed and currently awaiting endorsement • The Project managed to allocate Governmental Cost sharing funds USD 1.8 M • The allocated revenues have been re-injected into the PAs system focusing on infrastructure and visitors' facilities development. • The Project managed to allocate Governmental Cost sharing funds USD 1.8 M • The allocated revenues have been re-injected into the PAs system focusing on infrastructure and visitors' facilities development.
• A new Financial Management System has been developed by the Project to facilitate Governmental spending and revenue re-injection policy • According to this new system the revenues are transferred from Ministry of Environment to a special PAs account at an independent third party Operationa Unite for Development Assistance (OUDA) of Ministry of International Cooperation • This new policy has proven to be very successful and efficient where the spending rate surpasses 95% last year
• Target achieved: A financial sustainability and economics unit was established within the NCS • The project is working closely with this unit and other department at Ministry of Environment to increase human capacities related to financial sustainability issues • Three pilot projects focusing on financial sustainability are currently been implemented at Wadi Degla, Petrified Forest and Blue Hole PAs A set of actions has been taken to develop enabling legal and regulatory framework for NCS financial sustainability. • This includes development of : The PA financing strategy, Institutional framework for the financial strategy resource mobilization strategy, economic valuation studies, concession management framework and the establishment of an independent agency for PAs (The Nature Conservation Authority). • The total revenues generated by PAs system in 2012-2017 is approximately $26 million. • During this reporting period: o USD 4.5 M has been allocated from Ministry of Environment to PAs system and injected into the PAs Special Account o Around USD 75000 of revenues has been generated from the newly introduced visitors entrance fees at Wadi El Gemal NP during the past six months • During this reporting period: o USD 1.8 M has been re-injected and spent for the PAs infrastructure and visitors’ facilities o Additional amount of USD 4.5 M has been re-injected and workplan has been prepared for the activities

Support local communities in South Sinai by completing El Gharana village and relocation of the local communities for better living conditions. support eco-tourism in South Sinai in the Blue Hole by upgrading the protected area and providing basic services to the visitors. Complete and implement he permit system into the protected areas. Apply the E-ticketing.

Due to unforeseen circumstances the project did not complete the El Gharana village relocation of the local communities however, the financial strategy of protected areas was completed and E-ticketing was applied thus increasing income to the protected areas which in turn will help in the upgrading of the areas. Upgrading of the Blue Hole completed with basic services making it a world class eco-touristic site. Permit system applied thus contributing to the nature conversation.

The introduction of entrance fees at Wadi El Gemal NP was applied The Development of Wadi Degla & Petrified Forest Sustainable Financing and Management Model completed The Development of Blue Hole Dive Site Sustainable Financing and Management plan completed with the necessary infrastructure to support the system. Review and update of Wadi Degla camping fees and of PA concession pricing system was applied. This resulted in income generation for the protected areas.
